alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 10 at 3:59AM MST until March 10 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FRIDAY FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES, AND RECEPTIVE FUELS... .Southwest winds will strengthen over the northeast highlands on Friday with low relative humidity, above normal temperatures, and very dry fuels. Critical fire weather conditions are forecast for several hours during the afternoon along the I-25 corridor from near Las Vegas to Raton. Stronger west winds develop Saturday over more of the forecast area and a fire weather watch has been issued as a result. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 5 PM MST this afternoon. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Saturday morning through Saturday afternoon. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) late this morning through this afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts near 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...14 to 19%. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
